meanings.definition: Excessively harsh or cruel in manner or treatment.
meanings.sent1: The overbrutal punishment left the child in tears.
meanings.sent2: The overbrutal teacher yelled at the students for a small mistake.
meanings.sent3: The overbrutal chef accidentally added too much salt to the soup.
meanings.sent4: The overbrutal winter storm brought heavy snow and freezing temperatures.
meanings.sent5: The overbrutal judge sentenced the first-time offender to a long prison term.

meanings.definition: To act in a brutal or violent manner beyond what is necessary or appropriate.
meanings.sent1: He tends to overbrutalize situations when he gets angry.
meanings.sent2: The soldier was criticized for overbrutalizing the enemy prisoners.
meanings.sent3: The toddler overbrutaled his toys by throwing them around the room.
meanings.sent4: The dictator overbrutaled his power by suppressing any form of dissent.
meanings.sent5: The wrestler overbrutaled his opponent, causing an uproar in the audience.
